com.ibm.jaggr.service.impl.deps

Class BooleanFormula

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.jaggr.service.impl.deps.BooleanFormula
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<BooleanTerm>, Collection<BooleanTerm>, Set<BooleanTerm>

    public class BooleanFormula
extends Object
implements Set<BooleanTerm>, Serializable
    Object that represents a boolean expression in Disjunctive Normal Form (DNF)
    e.g. (A*B*C)|(!A*B)|(B*!C)

    The variable names are instances of BooleanVar.

    The group of variables that are and'ed together are terms (a.k.a. clauses), instances of BooleanTerm.

    The group of terms that are or'ed together are the formula encapsulated by this object.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BooleanFormula

        public BooleanFormula()
        Default constructor. Constructs a formula that evaluates to false.

      • BooleanFormula

        public BooleanFormula(boolean state)
        Constructs a formula that evaluates to the specified boolean state.
        Parameters:
        state - The initial state of the formula

      • BooleanFormula

        public BooleanFormula(BooleanFormula other)
        Copy constructor. Constructs a formula which has the same state as the specified formula.
        Parameters:
        other - The formula who's state this formula should copy.

      • BooleanFormula

        public BooleanFormula(String str)
        Constructs a formula who's state is given by the specified string. The string takes the form of (A*B)|(A*!C) Used mostly by unit test cases.
        Parameters:
        str - The string representation of the formula

    • Method Detail

      • simplify

        public BooleanFormula simplify()
        Returns an instance of this class which is the simplified representation of the formula represented by this object. May return this object if the formula is already simplified.

        This method uses the Quine-McCluskey algorithm and code described at http://en.literateprograms.org/Quine-McCluskey_algorithm_%28Java%29

        Returns:
        The simplified representation of this formula, or this object, if already simplified.

      • resolveWith

        public BooleanFormula resolveWith(Features features)
        Resolves the formula using the boolean values specified in features. If there are no more un-resolved variables in the forumula, the resulting formula will be either TRUE or FALSE.
        Parameters:
        features - the values to assign to variables in the formula
        Returns:
        this object

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(BooleanFormula other)
        Adds the terms from the specified formula to this formula
        Parameters:
        other - The formula who's terms are to be added
        Returns:
        True if the formula was modified.

      • andWith

        public BooleanFormula andWith(BooleanFormula other)
        Logically ands the provided terms with the terms in the formula, replacing this formula with the result
        Parameters:
        terms - the terms to and with this formula
        Returns:
        this object.

      • removeTerms

        public boolean removeTerms(Set<BooleanTerm> toRemove)
        Removes the specified terms from the formula
        Parameters:
        toRemove - The set of terms to remove
        Returns:
        True if the formula was modified

      • isTrue

        public boolean isTrue()
        Returns true if the formula is known to evaluate to true. Note that the formula may contain terms that logically evaluate to true but will not be recognized by this method. To determine if the formula logically evaluates to true, call this method on the value returned by simplify().
        Returns:
        True if the formula is known to evaluate to true

      • isFalse

        public boolean isFalse()
        Returns true if the formula is known to evaluate to false. Note that the formula may contain terms that logically evaluate to false but will not be recognized by this method. To determine if the formula logically evaluates to false, call this method on the value returned by simplify().
        Returns:
        True if the formula is known to evaluate to false

      • add

        public boolean add(BooleanTerm booleanTerm)
        Adds the term to the formula. Note that if the formula has previously been simplified and determined to evaluate to true, then adding any term will have no effect.

        A null term represents an expression of true and sets the formula to true (null).

        Specified by:
        add in interface Collection<BooleanTerm>
        Specified by:
        add in interface Set<BooleanTerm>
        Returns:
        true if the formula was modified

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Returns true if the set of terms encapsulated by this object is equal to the set of terms of the other object. Note that this is not the same as the formulas being logically the same. If you want to determine if two instances of this class represent the same logical expression, then call simplify() on both objects before comparing the returned objects for equality.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Collection<BooleanTerm>
        Specified by:
        equals in interface Set<BooleanTerm>
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
